citations.narrative:
A complete physical examination of each dog at the facility has not been completed by the Attending Veterinarian (AV)
within the last 12 months. The AV visited the facility in June and November 2024, however, a head to tail physical exam
has not been completed for each of the dogs since January 2024.
This exam is important to ensure that all dogs at the facility are in good health and that medical conditions are addressed
in a timely manner.
A complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the Attending Veterinarian must be performed not less
than once every 12 months.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 4, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires (April 6, 2025).
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A complete physical examination of each dog at the facility has not been completed by the Attending Veterinarian (AV) 
within the last 12 months. The AV visited the facility in June and November 2024, however, a head to tail physical exam 
has not been completed for each of the dogs since January 2024.  
This exam is important to ensure that all dogs at the facility are in good health and that medical conditions are addressed 
in a timely manner.  
A complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the Attending Veterinarian must be performed not less 
than once every 12 months. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 4, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires (April 6, 2025).
